intro: Wahlenbergia paniculata var. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth wahlenbergia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its blue or violet tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The flowers are often arranged in panicles, giving the plant a delicate, airy appearance.
